name: R5-SearchParamType-R4-SearchParamType
title: Concept map to convert a FHIR R5 SearchParamType into a FHIR R4 SearchParamType

element.display: A composite search parameter that combines a search on two values together.

target.display: A composite search parameter that combines a search on two values together.

element.display: Search parameter is on a date/time. The date format is the standard XML format, though other formats may be supported.

target.display: Search parameter is on a date/time. The date format is the standard XML format, though other formats may be supported.

element.display: Search parameter SHALL be a number (a whole number, or a decimal).

target.display: Search parameter SHALL be a number (a whole number, or a decimal).

element.display: A search parameter that searches on a quantity.

target.display: A search parameter that searches on a quantity.

element.display: A reference to another resource (Reference or canonical).

target.display: A reference to another resource (Reference or canonical).

element.display: Special logic applies to this parameter per the description of the search parameter.

target.display: Special logic applies to this parameter per the description of the search parameter.

element.display: Search parameter is a simple string, like a name part. Search is case-insensitive and accent-insensitive. May match just the start of a string. String parameters may contain spaces.

target.display: Search parameter is a simple string, like a name part. Search is case-insensitive and accent-insensitive. May match just the start of a string. String parameters may contain spaces.

element.display: Search parameter on a coded element or identifier. May be used to search through the text, display, code and code/codesystem (for codes) and label, system and key (for identifier). Its value is either a string or a pair of namespace and value, separated by a "|", depending on the modifier used.

target.display: Search parameter on a coded element or identifier. May be used to search through the text, display, code and code/codesystem (for codes) and label, system and key (for identifier). Its value is either a string or a pair of namespace and value, separated by a "|", depending on the modifier used.

element.display: A search parameter that searches on a URI (RFC 3986).

target.display: A search parameter that searches on a URI (RFC 3986).
